messages.content: This election will be one of the most important in recent years.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Funding for the NHS and a commitment to protect the budgets for nurseries, schools, and colleges.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour have taken Camden for granted for too long. It's time for a change.

issues.economy: The Liberal Democrats are the only party that is committed to balancing a stronger economy with a fairer society.
issues.education: A commitment to protect the budgets for nurseries, schools, and colleges so that everyone has the chance to get on in life.
issues.health: Funding for the NHS and a commitment to protect the budgets for nurseries, schools, and colleges.

housing.content: Ensure a new Secondary School on Adelaide Road, save Kentish Town baths from Labour's closure plans, and bring more police officers to Camden Town.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am standing for Parliament because I want to represent the place where I live, where I work and where I brought up my children.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helped to revitalize Queen's Crescent Market and set up an apprenticeship scheme for young people to learn the skills they need. Ensured a new Secondary School on Adelaide Road, saved Kentish Town baths from Labour's closure plans, and brought more police officers to Camden Town.

leaflet.additionalNotes: PS – on 7th May use your vote for a local choice – someone who will stand up for this area in Parliament.
